channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Threads
channel.desc: The story of a nuclear attack on Britain and what remains for the unlucky survivors. Contains some strong language, graphic violence and disturbing scenes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Timothy Spall
channel.desc: On the first leg of the trip, Timothy misreads the tides near Fishguard, visits Shane's home town of Aberystwyth and finds a lovely cove at Porthdinllaen.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Walk the Line with Barra Best
channel.desc: Criss-crossing some of Northern Ireland's most spectacular countryside, Barra Best explores County Tyrone's lost railway routes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The War Game
channel.desc: Controversial film depicting the terrible consequences of a nuclear attack on Britain. Contains scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Hurricanes and Heatwaves
channel.desc: Highs and Lows of British Weather. A look at the evolution of the weather forecast from print via radio to TV and beyond.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: This is BBC Four
channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: This is BBC Four
channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Back to the Future
channel.desc: Marty McFly is always late - until the day he finds himself 30 years early.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Funny Girl
channel.desc: The Oscar-winning film debut of Barbra Streisand, portraying the bittersweet life of singer-comedienne Fanny Brice in early 20th-century New York.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Graduate
channel.desc: An aimless college graduate finds himself torn between his older lover and her daughter. Deals with adult themes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Dustin Hoffman
channel.desc: Moments from interviews conducted on a range of BBC shows over the years help to tell the story of Dustin Hoffman, one of Hollywood's biggest stars, and his films.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: DeLorean
channel.desc: The rise and fall of John DeLorean and his attempt to build the car of the future. Contains some strong language.

channel.title: This is BBC Four
channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.title: This is BBC Four
channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 6 March 1998 and featuring Cornershop, Finley Quaye, Robyn, Space feat Cerys Matthews, Spice Girls and Madonna.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, featuring Natalie Imbruglia, Simple Minds, Five, Ginuwine, Cast from Casualty, Shed Seven, Lionrock and Celine Dion.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Bach and Mendelssohn at the Proms
channel.desc: The first televised Prom from the Glasshouse in Gateshead, featuring two classical masterpieces: Bach's dramatic Keyboard Concerto in D Minor and Mendelssohn's 'Lobgesang' Symphony.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Janice Long and Mike Read present the pop chart programme, featuring Spandau Ballet, The Jesus and Mary Chain, Five Star, Stan Ridgway and Chris de Burgh.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Simon Bates and Gary Davies present the pop chart programme. Featuring Black Lace, Kane Gang, A Flock of Seagulls, Trevor Walters, George Michael and Frankie Goes to Hollywood.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Cher at the BBC
channel.desc: Turn back time on a journey through the BBC archives to celebrate singing superstar Cher with a selection of songs and chat show moments featuring many of the her greatest hits.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Cher Meets Rylan
channel.desc: The goddess of pop sits down for a fun and in-depth chat with Rylan Clark about her new record, her biggest hits and her incredible life and career.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Viva La Diva
channel.desc: The word 'diva' is used to describe otherworldly talent, but somewhere along the line, the meaning got polluted. Ana Matronic reclaims the word by presenting five legendary artists.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Agatha Christie
channel.desc: Lucy examines Agatha Christie's later life, discovering how she became the queen of crime.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Miss Marple
channel.desc: When the Colonel is found murdered in the vicar's study, Miss Marple has to whittle down her long list of suspects. After all, the Colonel was not a popular man.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Cairo Conspiracy
channel.desc: A fisherman's son is offered the chance to study at the Al-Azhar University in Cairo, but he soon becomes a pawn in the conflict between Egypt's religious and political elites.
